paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the effects of BRCA2 mutations in zebrafish models, particularly focusing on the brca2Q658X mutation. It explores the phenotypic consequences of this mutation in embryonic development and adult tissue response to injury, but does not provide detailed penetrance data or individual-level records for human cases.

patients.phenotype: Embryonic lethality in zebrafish, cancer predisposition in adults

functional_data.summary: The brca2Q658X mutation results in a truncated protein lacking most functional domains, leading to embryonic lethality and cancer predisposition in zebrafish.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation is similar in location and type to human BRCA2 mutations associated with cancer.
key_quotes: We have previously described a brca2-mutant zebrafish model in which the brca2Q658X mutation (nonsense mutation; RAD51 binding domain) is similar in location and type to pathologic BRCA2 mutations associated with human cancer.

challenges: The paper focuses on zebrafish models, limiting human penetrance data extraction.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper does not provide human penetrance data or individual-level records, focusing instead on zebrafish models.
